Articles.Content:
I prefer Terran. Yeah, it's overused, but it sound cool, and it will fit us better when we go interstellar. Just imagine...

Jeb: The Earthling Empire just expanded into the Kerbol System.

Bob: "Earthling"? What are they, weaklings? They sound weak. This will be an ea-

*[12:11:91]Munshot Ship was deestroyed by railgun*

Contrasted too...

Jeb: The Terran Empire just sent in a colony ship to Laythe.

Bob: Oh (censored). We are screwed now. Quickly! Hide!

*[12:11:91]Munshot Escape Pod decoupled from Munshot Ship*

Sounds a lot more indimitating. Earthling makes us seem like non-sentient pigs....

Edited June 13, 2013 by NASAFanboy

Human.

It doesn't refer to our home planet, but to our species; which will be in something more than Earth (Terra) when we go interstellar.

Human.

It doesn't refer to our home planet, but to our species; which will be in something more than Earth (Terra) when we go interstellar.

Human means something like "From Earth" in Old English.
I prefer the name human because it can distinguish us from other species that live on Earth/Terra.

I do not think that we have a name awesome enough yet.

http://1d4chan.org/wiki/Humanity_****_Yeah

Edited June 13, 2013 by Jones-250
Better "sauce"!
I like Terrran the best. Everything else just sounds too 50s sci-fi.
I like terran it reminds me of SC
terran no since it reminds me of planetside to much ,but Humans since you can say Hum-mans
Terran. Sounds the most fitting. Also, Earth is also called Terra, so.... WAY BETTER
Targets, or if you prefer, prey? Uh no wait, just kidding, how about super intelligent creatures? Yeah! That's it! Whew.. Almost blew our cover......wait, is this thing still recording? Dammit!
